suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: The library-worker skill procedure is package-centric and assumes changes under packages/<pkg>. For reference/example-project work under examples/, the strict red-phase and package-specific verification guidance is not always a natural fit. Consider adding a note or alternate workflow for examples/ work.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: Features os-358-reference-project and fix-reference-scrutiny both flagged this mismatch in their handoff skillFeedback. The fix-reference-scrutiny worker also reported skipping the red phase for a docs+examples fix while marking followedProcedure=true.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: The docs-worker skill procedure requires lint + typecheck + test in verification, but the migration-v06-docs worker only ran lint while reporting followedProcedure=true. Consider enforcing all three validators or clarifying which are required for docs-only changes.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: docs-worker skill (.factory/skills/docs-worker/SKILL.md lines 64-71) requires bun run lint, bun run typecheck, and bun run test. Handoff for worker session 2f362eb7 records only bun run lint under verification.commandsRun.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: Update the NDJSON progress event example in mission AGENTS.md Streaming Design Context section to remove the 'name' field from the progress event, since StreamProgressEvent in packages/contracts/src/stream.ts only has type/current/total/message fields.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: AGENTS.md line 75 shows progress event with 'name' field; packages/contracts/src/stream.ts:78-89 defines StreamProgressEvent with only type, current, total, message (no name).

rejectedObservations.observation: fix-reference-scrutiny reviewer flagged library-worker skill procedure mismatch for mixed docs+examples fix work
